entry.title: Vanuatu volcano puts on primal show for those daring to visit
entry.summary: Yasur volcano erupts on Tanna Island in Vanuatu on June 1, 2015 photo.

entry.title: Up close: Vanuatu volcano puts on a glittering, primal show
entry.summary:
At just 361 meters (1,184 feet) elevation, the volcano on the Pacific archipelago of Vanuatu is particularly accessible, and spectacularly active.

Some have dubbed it the world's friendliest volcano, although its primal ferocity and occasionally dangerous eruptions of lava and gas would seem to defy that description.

Legend has it that the volcano is a god.

"It's quite rare to get such a kind of activity in a volcano," he said.

entry.title: Up close: Vanuatu volcano puts on a glittering, primal show
entry.summary: "But people have to be very careful when they walk up the volcano," he said.

entry.title: Colima Volcano Still Spewing Ash in Mexico
entry.summary: Ash and cinders spewed Saturday from the Colima Volcano in western Mexico, prompting authorities to close the airport in the state capital of Colima and order the evacuation of a half dozen hamlets on the flanks of the peak.

entry.title: 70 evacuated as Colima volcano spews ash in western Mexico
entry.summary: Lava flows down the banks of the Colima Volcano, also known as the...

entry.title: 70 evacuated as Colima volcano spews ash in western Mexico
entry.summary: Clouds of ash fill the sky after an eruption by the Colima volcano, known as the Volcano of Fire, near the town of Comala, Mexico, Friday, July 10, 2015.

entry.title: 19 evacuated as Colima volcano spews ash in western Mexico
entry.summary:
The volcano began erupting on Thursday and has become increasingly active, leading officials to relocate people from the community of Yerbabuena in the municipality of Comala.

The Colima Volcano, which sits near the border of the western states of Colima and Jalisco, is also known as the Volcano of Fire.

entry.title: Ash and cinders prompt evacuation of village near Colima volcano in western Mexico
entry.summary: MEXICO CITY - Ash and cinders spewing from the Colima Volcano in western Mexico have prompted authorities to evacuate 19 people from a nearby village.

entry.title: Colima Volcano blasts ash, lava in western Mexico
entry.summary: A volcano in western Mexico has erupted, spewing ash more than 4 miles (7 kilometers) into the air and sending lava down its flanks.

entry.title: Colima Volcano blasts ash, lava in western Mexico
entry.summary: The activity at the Colima Volcano began Thursday and continued Friday morning.

entry.title: Eruption of Indonesian volcano sparks travel chaos
entry.summary:
A 2010 eruption of Iceland's Eyjafjallajokul volcano produced an ash cloud that caused a week of international aviation chaos, with more than 100,000 flights cancelled.

Another Indonesian volcano, Mount Sinabung in Sumatra, has been erupting for two months, forcing the evacuation of more than 10,000 people.

entry.title: Thousands stranded in Indonesian as volcano closes airports
Volcano sparks Java travel chaos
entry.summary:
Ash spewing from a volcano on Indonesia's main island of Java has sparked chaos for holidaymakers as airports close and international airlines cancel flights to tourist hotspot Bali.

Evacuation of residents living near the volcano is still considered unnecessary, but authorities are urging people to wear masks.

The volcano has proven particularly problematic for Australians, who flock to Bali during Australia's school holidays.
